raw_text: Dang et al (1998) showed that multiple listings could in some cases be interpreted as regular sense xtensions, and defined intersective Levin classes, which are a more line-grained, syntactically and semantically coherent refinement of basic Levin classes
clean_text: Dang et al (1998) showed that multiple listings could in some cases be interpreted as regular sense extensions, and defined intersective Levin classes, which are a more fine-grained, syntactically and semantically coherent refinement of basic Levin classes.

citing_paper_authors: Omri, Abend | Roi, Reichart | Ari, Rappoport
raw_text: VN is built on a refinement of the Levin classes, the intersective Levin classes (Dang et al, 1998), aimed at achieving more coherent classes both semantically and syntactically
clean_text: VN is built on a refinement of the Levin classes, the intersective Levin classes (Dang et al, 1998), aimed at achieving more coherent classes both semantically and syntactically.

raw_text: Dang et al (1998) have supplemented the taxonomy with intersective classes: special classes for verbs which share membership of more than one Levin class because of regular polysemy
